conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and must be predicted to flow into containers E, F, or G after passing through baffles.

Source A is yellow, Source B is yellow, Source C is blue, and Source D is white. Containers E, F, and G are green, red, and white respectively. There are black, yellow, gray, and white baffles positioned between the sources and containers.
Liquid from Source A flows downward and is stopped by the black baffle.
Liquid from Source A flows to the right along the black baffle.
Liquid from Source A continues straight down and flows into container F.
Liquid from Source B flows downward past the yellow baffle.
Liquid from Source B continues straight down.
Liquid from Source B flows into container F.
Liquid from Source C flows downward past the gray baffle.
Liquid from Source C flows straight down and continues past the white baffle.
Liquid from Source C flows into container G.
Liquid from Source D flows downward.
Liquid from Source D flows straight down past the gray baffle.
Liquid from Source D flows into container G.
Liquid from A and B flows into container F, and liquid from C and D flows into container G.
